title.narrative: Assistance to Syrian People in Lattakia and Hassaké

description.narrative: The protracted crisis in Syria has resulted in the collapse of the economy, limited access to goods and services. For many Syrians, the ongoing conflict is a daily reality and is resulting into extreme violence. Syrians continued to be used as active ware fare means, directly targeted by starvation and bombings. In Syria 13.5 million people are in need of humanitarian assistance, including 6.5 million IDPs, of whom 4.8 million are in besieged or hard to reach areas. Limited humanitarian access, extreme high vulnerability levels, and increasing basic commodity prices are leading to increased reliance on negative coping mechanisms by vulnerable families, impacting the lives of both host and IDP families. IDPs were forced to abandon assets and income sources, while host communities experience pressure related to increased demand for local resources and services.

mailing-address.narrative: Grote Marktstraat 45, Den Haag, Zuid Holland, 2511 BH
